intro: Tarenna zippeliana, commonly known as the Zippeliana tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
